column2: bjr28, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Although I feel that Zyprexa is the most efficacious anti-psychotic on the market (it just has very serious side effects, such as diabetes related to weight gain), in my opinion, Abilify is (perhaps surprisingly) a close second.  Abilify has very minimal side effects (unlike most of the other anti-psychotics); however, it didn't completely quell my symptoms - I still experienced some psychotic feelings.  This is not surprising, however, because Abilify is the newest (and "weakest") anti-psychotic.  By "weakest" I am referring to the fact that it is only a partial dopamine agonist, which, in some cases, facilitates the manifestation of some psychotic symptoms.  However, for many people, Abilify is a highly efficacious drug.  For me, however, it just wasn't quite strong enough, so I switched to Zyprexa (which quells my psychotic symptoms, but has its own related side effects *see my Zyprexa posting*).  In sum, Abilify is a very gentle drug that is well tolerated by many people.  Given the potential side effects of other anti-psychotic drugs, I would try Abilify as my first line of defense.  Who knows?  It just might work.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug SHOULD NOT be used for bipolar II!!!!!! I was a part of a clinical trial for this drug and the side effects were horrible. I had nausea, slurred speech, irritablity, severe restlessness (could not sit for more than 2min), increased manic thoughts, rapid speech/thinking, along with several other less severe side effects. Also, my depression was not helped by this drug and I had to take lexapro to control that. I also had to take something else to help me sleep and I still did not sleep for very long. I do NOT reccomend this drug for anyone dealing with bipolar II. The risks simply outweigh the benefits. Also there are many other treatments such as seroquel that, for me at least, can be much more effective. (Note: some of these effects take a bit longer to show up than others.)

All in all, I remained depressed and suicidal. if it helped any, I was too lazy & tired to act on it.  When getting off Abilify, it took my body 8 months to return to normal, in order to lose the weight, after taking it only 1 1/2 months.  Weigh your pros and cons.

column2: booboo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My attorney is preparing a malpratice lawsuit.  My psychiatrist apparently did read the manufactor's prescribing instructions.  I could not afford this medication at one point in time.  10 days later,  akathisia set in.  Akathisia is one gigantic horror experience.  Then I contacted the physician explained my symptoms, for which he never ever mentioned akathisia.  This guy is nothing more than cruel.  At the second to last visit, I was complaining about not being able to get off this drug.  He replied in a very LOUD VOICE, "Oh, for God's sake, you're not even on a therapeutic dose!"  Iwas stunned.  Why would doctor prescribe a non-therapeutic dose?  I think I have Bipolar II not 1.  Last session, he bowed his head, using a humble voice said, "I think you are right to get off Abilify.  After all,  tardive dyskinisia could have been growing, becoming more permanent."  I have been diagnosed with permanent tardive dyskinisia and akathisia by a neurologist.  Why is it that the sheriff doesn't simply make an arrest as other criminals?  I left a voice mail for him saying, "Have you ever heard of a word, akathisia, just google it and then you will know the definition.  Then do you mind sending information to my home address, please?"  No response.  He took 2 months to send my records to my primary care doctor when it was suppose to take 3 days according to his office staff.  There is much more to my story but my advice is NEVER, NEVER EVER TRUST ANY HEATH CARE PROVIDER FOR ANY REASON!  DO YOUR HOMEWORK AND GET A 2ND OPINION.  THE CODE OF ETHICS HAS DISAPPEAREDIN ALL PROFESSIONS.  I could write a book.

column9: In the first few days I noticed I wasn't sleeping as much ...that was av ery good thing.  By day 4 I had a great day - even went shopping BY MYSELF!! Day 5 through 2 weeks I went downhill.  I had dry mouth, sore throat, dizzy, confused, lethargic, unfocused, chest pain, slurring,cough, shaky, queasy, vomited, stomach cramps, my tongue felt like it was an inch thick, increased thirst/urination, loss of appetite, swollen nasal passages and started getting very sleepy again!!! It was definitely a scary time for me.  Good Luck to you.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on alot of different meds, but this med, so far... has been working. Each day I feel more like the person I once was. Knowing I am bipolar, Dr. put me on Zoloft, and only Zoloft alone. No mood stabilizer or anything. I feel into the worst case of depression. Finally, I was put on this drug and Depakote, and I'm feeling great. I've been on this combination of meds for about one month. Getting used to Abilify was a challenge. I felt very manic. Couldn't sit still, had to move my feet and legs, and couldn't sleep at night. I was put on  med to help temporarily with sleeping problems. Now that I'm sleeping, and the meds were increased, I'm doing better, for now. Everyone needs to remember, being bipolar isn't a choice. It take alot of tries to get the correct meds, but hang in there. You will be strong, and will be back to the things that you once loved.

column9: Let's be real people, this drug has done some pretty amazing things with my "extreme" episodes and my overall outlook.  BUT that is only after many different other anti-psychotics before and trying to find the correct dosage.....  so important!!  Was all the way to max at 30mg and had symptoms of Parkinson's Disease, sent to see neurologist twice, then lowered to 20mg, then at 10mg where I have been stable at for over 3y with little reoccurance of manic swings, voices, hallucinations or depressive suicidal idealation, ect.  Also take Prozac, Colodipine, and Remeron to make my strange cocktail......  took almost 1y to figure correct amount.  Insist on low dosage at first, then titrate up slowly due to real symptomatic reactions like unvoluntary shaking and body movements!!  Warn your doctors about these REAL side effects.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: TragicallyUninformed, 35-44 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: At 14 our son began taking Concerta for ADHD. At 16 our son was diagnosed as Bipolar and began taking Trileptal. At the age of 17 Abilify was added. After taking Abilify along with Trileptal and Concerta for several months the dosage of Abilify was increased from 5mg to 10mg.  Sadly within 36 hours (Friday pm to Sunday am) he committed suicide.   After the tragedy had occurred two people came forward to tell us that he had complained that his medication was making him feel unstable. In retrospect we recall that there was a noticeable increase in volatility within just 24 hours.  The event that triggered suicide occurred 36 hours after the increase, when he wrecked his car.  When he arrived home after wrecking his car it was apparent that he was not himself. He was extremely agitated and irrational and within 10 minutes had taken his life.  Although we were taken aback by the increase in mood swings, we did not associate his behavior with the increase of his medication.  I believe this tragedy may have been avoided if the Dr. prescribing this med had clearly informed us of the warning signs associated with the increase in dosage.  When we notified the Dr. of the tragedy his response was shock and disbelief.  He stated that he believed our son was "doing so well".  It seems apparent to me that the doctor had become comfortable in his Dr/Patient relationship with our son and therefore may have minimized the warnings and risks associated with Abilify when taken by teens. My intention is not to place blame but rather to highlight the need for better communication between Dr's and both patients and parents.  Warning signs and side effects should be clearly stated each time there is a change/increase regardless of the length of time the patient has been taking the medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was always happy as I remember, but I also felt that I was "not right". I never really told anyone because they would just brush it off, or tell me that I'm imagining things when I tried.  When I was 24 everything finally caught up to me. Attempted suicide, but someone found me and took me to the hospital. Obviously I was saved.  I was put on Zyprexa 7.5mg. It worked good.  But I gained 40 lbs in less than two months!  I was then switched to Abilify but honestly it did nothing for me.  I felt like I wasn't even taking anything. So I was switched to Geodon, which made me very very ill, throwing up for over a month before I switched Dr.'s because mine didn't believe that the vomiting was a side effect. I lost all of the weight I gained, which was great! But it was just horrible living off freeze pops and in and out of the hospital many many times for I.V's. for dehydration. I am now on Seroquel 400mg. Works great but I'm back up to the 40lb gain again. I have a Dr. appt coming up soon in which I will discuss alternatives.  But all in all, Abilify might be a great solution to other people so don't take my word for it about not working.  It just wasn't the right one for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Lexapro, 20 mg/day for depression. It helped a lot, but adding Abilify brought my mood up to a whole new level. I haven't felt this good in years. I am only on 2.5 mg/day. (I cut a 5 mg pill in half)..and have been on the drug only about ten days. I feel a huge difference already. I had trouble getting out of bed and starting my day before, now I am up early and anxious to get the day going, excited about life again. I feel more energetic than I have in years.A couple of downsides I have noticed: It seems like most reviews say that the drug makes them tired, but I seem to be having the opposite issue, insomnia. I now take it in the morning, and hopefully that will help. I am also experiencing constipation, which is one of the possible side effects. As far as I am concerned though, it's all worth it, this drug is a wonder drug for me!

column9: OMG - I took this med for approx. 6 months - I try very hard to give something a chance.  I developed a tremor in my left hand that was never there before - and now I have neuropathy, in other words permanent damage from it.  I sit here and cry thinking of this, and wondering just how much damage these other psychotropics do.  I am so frustrated I would throw the whole messy cocktail down the sink, but now I'm old enough to realize there is *something* in that nauseating mix that keeps me relatively sane.  Bottom line is that I will avoid this med at all costs. column2: Jonquil, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter (8) has been on Ability for almost 1 year.  We have tried several different doses to find the right one.  She had rapid weight gain,"fuzzy brain", and just not our girl with 7 and 10 mg.  She had been taking 5 mg for about four months. Her weight leveled off but she did have periodic nose bleeds, hot flushes.  She started making a funny noise when talking so we reduced her dose to 2.5 mg.  The noise went away but her ability to cope with her anger and impluse control was not there.  We went back to 5 mg and now we are dealing with nose bleeds, hot flushes, and increased appetite.  We just started giving her 3.75 mg to see if that is the magic dose.  It has been a rollercoaster ride and I worry about the affects on her overall health. We have scheduled a Dr.'s appointment to have her thoroughly checked out. It is comforting to see her have impluse control which has allowed her to develop friendships and have a more positive attitude.

(In the event my email address does not show completely in the "Screen Name" box, it is: found1another@aol.com)

I also have had to watch my blood sugar as it runs in the family and the fasting was 116.  Overall I will take the weight yo-yo and watch the blood sugar because the benefits outweight the bad.

column2: p84q3o, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
lifeisgood, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 56 and have suffered from depression for 35 years. I stay on maintenance dose of Prozac. Since menopause began several years ago I have suffered increasing depressive episodes. I recently started on 2 mg Abilify to increase to 5 mg after 3 days. Noticed a positive difference imediately. The first 3 days were awesome! I was able to concentrate, remember things,and I felt a burst of energy. I accomphised more in 1 day than the entire previous month! I actually went right to sleep at night and sleep well. I felt happy and SERENE. I had never felt that before. I increased to 5 mg and now I can't sleep and I feel hyper. My husband noticed a tremor in my hand and I feel nauseous right after taking. I will call my Doc first thing Monday to talk about decreasing back to 2 mg. At 2 mg it was a wonder drug for me. Perhaps some problems others have experienced are due to the dosage. We are all different and it may take some time to find what works, i.e., provides the benefit w/out nasty side effects. In spite of some of my concerns I am so grateful that I have a chance at a normal life. Good luck to all.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: *****CAUTION:PLEASE READ*****i took abilify about a year or two ago...so its been a while but i feel its my responsibility to warn people that you can have a dystonic reaction on this drug! its extremely rare my doctor said...apparently im special...i was 15-20 min away from dying...im only 19 and i was left with post traumatic stress disorder...i still have nightmares...this drug is a nightmare...ask your doctor if you have medications that may mix and result in a dystonic reaction...a dystonic reaction is when all the dopamine in your brain depletes...dopamine controls muscles...my blood pressure spiked,my tongue swole up making it almost impossible to breathe,my trachea would close shut repeatedly,i couldnt control any part of my body,my face contorted,my neck went as far back as it can possibly go,i was doing back bends,i couldnt speak all i could say in a muffled voice was "help me" it was traumatic for my parents and even my dad cried...its a very scary thing to watch someone you love go through...needless to say i was left with PTSD on top of my depression and bi polar...still haunted to this day...i beg you to check with your doctor & educate yourself further about the side effects...as my doctor did not...and i did not...take it upon yourself...dont let this happent to you!!!

25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been battling depression and anxiety problems for half my life. My doctor added Abilify to my medications (Wellbutrin SR, Xanax, Topamax [for migraine disorder] and Nexium [for GERD]). I felt no change the first few days, but didn't expect to because he started me on the lowest dosage. After a couple days I started feeling general achiness like the flu was coming on. By day four I was curled up in a ball crying because every bone and muscle in my body ached and I could hardly move. My boyfriend grabbed all my prescriptions and the pharmacy leaflets and took me to the ER. Good thing he read the leaflet for Abilify while I was being triaged and pointed out the list of "rare but dangerous" side effects that should prompt you to "seek immediate medical attention" to avoid "life threatening and/or permanent injury". The ER staff had no idea what to do for me, so they started an IV, flushed two bags of saline through me, and ran labs to make sure my liver function was still normal. I was there a total of three hours, and all they said was don't take any more of the Abilify and come back if you get worse. And they reminded me to call my Doctor. It took nearly a week for my body to return to normal, and it was the most painful week I can remember having.

To those of you who are having troubles with sleeping at night, you should talk to your doctor and see if he/she will prescribe you some Ambien or Lunesta.  I was already taking Ambien prior to starting the Abilify, so I haven't had ANY PROBLEMS with sleeping at night.  However, I have had some really nagging nausea...so much to the point that I don't want to get out of bed for fear that I will "spew" everywhere.  I am hoping that this is only a temporary side effect and that it will go away fairly soon.  I really would like to see if this medication works for me...

column9: To begin, I have no physical health problems and am a normal weight. I took only one low dose of Abilify before going to bed and I fell asleep within minutes. I also had strong suicidal urges for those couple of days (and never did before until that one pill). If I took one more pill I would have either died from pain or killed myself. column9: I've been on Abilify for two weeks along with 200 mg of Zoloft, and 200 mg of Trazadone at night. I also take Xanax ( 1 mg) 4 x daily, Soma, 3-4 daily, Percocets 4 daily. I have been through alot of stress over the past 18 months, and tried to comment suicide. My daughter was in the car wreck with me that has disabled me for life, and she has her arotic & mitral valve replaced. Things for my daughter have not gotten better. Just last year she  had over 80 blood transfusions, among other things. The car wreck left me with 7 broken ribs, two budgling discs, torn ligaments, and a broken hand that no one ever noticed.I am completely disabled in my left arm & hand. I had a collasped lung, and a big hole in my arm.  Zoloft worked for awhile, then my Dr. added Abilify and I feel its made a word of difference. I now look forward to doing things. I haven't done anything but  go to the doctors, hospitals with my daughter. The rest of the days I stayed in my Pjs and in a dark room and cried all the time. I still can't run a marathron, and have to be VERY careful with daily activeties. I'm not going to say that I'm never depressed, because that would be a lie, but life is truely getting better. I have no insurance for myself, so I can't get the medical attention I need for my discs and neuropothy and broken hand. I wish everyone the best, give the medicine a chance.

column2: clk, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

I am practically symptom-free!  I have not had a major manic episode during this time.  My psychiatrist has adjusted my dosage twice during depressive episodes, but overall my moods have been VERY stable!!  I also take .25 mg of Klonopin at night to relieve anxiety and help me sleep.  Getting a good night's rest has also proven to be very helpful in controlling my bipolar symptoms.  I talk to my doctor regularly, and I am SO very thankful that he has me on Abilify!  It has changed my life!

column9: I take Abilify, (in addition to Depakote, Pristiq, Klonopin, Seroquel, and Trazodone) and have taken it for several years. Most importantly, it helps with some severe anxiety I have, associated with the case of Bipolar I that I have.  Several of my symptoms were gone within two weeks of starting Abilify, which was a pretty dramatic and much needed change!  I may have gained some weight while taking Abilify, but it could also be attributed to lifestyle or other medications.  I also know that my body "can't handle" a higher dose than 10 mgs or I get mild tremors.  Overall though, the positive effects definitely outweigh the negative.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: some guy, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been taking abilify for the past 8 months (approximately).  The effects of this medicine for me are varied.  Currently on 5 mg, thinking about going up to 10 or 20 mg.  I'll start with the cons first: Ive gained about 40-50 pounds eating the same amount of food I've been eating for years, I sleep for 10-14 hours a night, it hasn't stopped my depression, I'm less talkative to my significant other, I'm more stir-crazy than normal (I have jittery legs, feel some tension in my calves and shin), I lose my balance once in a while, my memory seems to be effected (more short term), I get hot much easier than normal (notwithstanding I live in AZ), I get little joy our of sex and masturbation, it's difficult to become happy, and I'm more apathetic than I was when I was manic and unmedicated.  The pros are as follow: manic episodes are much rarer, I'm able to control my emotions (when I have them) more than I could, and I've not cut myself for the time I've been taking this medication.  Honestly, there are a lot of cons to this medication, at least in my experience, even though I'm thinking about going to a higher dose because it seems like I'm building up a tolerance.  I still have outbursts at work and home, albeit much lessened (like I'll get pissed off at an incompetent client and will start swearing like a sailor once they're off the phone).  I still get overwhelmed by life, though not as much as before, though I find it hard to become motivated as well.  I guess I'll move to a higher dose, hopefully I don't keep gaining weight (and yes I go to the gym 3-4 days a week).  I don't think I'd really recommend this medication without trying something else first or without taking something else in conjunction to alleviate these negative side effects.  Granted, I'm just one person, however these side effects are pretty serious to me.  I'm like a slug now, with very little personality.  Moreover, I still have racing thoughts and suicidal impulses.  Those haven't gone away.

column2: Hope Springs Eternal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So far Abilify seems to be the best option for me.  I was taking Effexor with success in improved mood, but found my motivation and energy level were depleted.  Same thing with Lexapro.  I am much more energetic and "feel like myself again" in terms of energy and motivation, which improves my mood. I do feel dizzy/lightheaded at times, which is a little disorienting but not serious enough for me to be too bothered by it. column2: Deb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I know that I have only started taking abilify one dose, but I can already tell a difference.  I was diagnosed as bipolar I in November 08 at the age of 48.  After taking pretty much everything except lithium, I was FAIRLY stable taking 125mg lamictal and .50mg clonazepam with 5mg ambien to sleep.  However, I kept getting more and more hypomanic, with hypersexual tendencies.  My psych added 2.5mg abilify yesterday when I told her I was getting no better, only worse.  The only thing I have noticed today is some drowsiness.  I am to increase dosage to 5mg in 4 days.  If it has adverse side effects I will drop back down to 2.5mg.  After so many months of feeling totally not normal, it is very very refreshing to feel pretty much like I used to feel before the bp diagnosis.  I have gained weight before starting the abilify, about 15 lbs., but I needed it.  I could not eat or sleep for so many months when taking all the other meds that I looked horrible.  I do not need to gain anymore, however, so I am going to do my best to keep the eating under control.  My hope, and my docs, is if the abilify works, to get rid of the lamictal totally and only use the clonopin as needed.  That would be SO wonderful.  Taking all these different drugs when you are already "messed up in the head" is a nightmare.  I have very little depression with the bp, so I cannot speak for the effects on that, but my mania seems to be less today than since over a year ago. I will keep posting here on progress.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for over a year and learned that while being on it I am more susceptable to heat stroke and felt sick everyday- I live in Tucson, AZ & work outside year round.  So I stopped using it 2 weeks ago and am having some terrible effects going off it.  I feel physically sick like I have the flu.  Mentally I am having the same suicidal thoughts I had before and feel impulsive enough to act on them.  I have attempted to kill myself twice before going on this drug and now feel just as bad.  Not bad enough to go back on it, tho.  I went off this drug without dr suppervision which I would NOT recommend to anyone.  I hope this feeling passes soon.  I don't want to be another statistic.

column2: sarahbn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My two sons with Asperger's Syndrome are on Abilify.  (Yes, I know this is off-label and it's dangerous to give psych meds to kids, but they are under top-notch medical supervision and I thought it worth the risk; read on to know why.)  It has made a huge difference in their lives.Before the meds, one son was full of rage and constantly hurting others.  The other had no idea where his body was and once tried to jump out a second story window without even knowing it.  They were stimming all the time.  We tried other treatments like sensory diets and social stories, but it was too difficult to keep up with the needs of both of them plus my other two children who have multiple food allergies.  Our home was a living hell and I was totally exhausted.Since they've been on the meds, they've been calm long enough to start learning how to deal with their Asperger's and they've made lots of progress.  The older child has learned social skills and now has a circle of friends.  The younger child has moved from violent rage to merely saying he hates us, and is learning how to recognize when he's getting mad and withdraw to his room.The only thing I don't like about giving Abilify to my boys is that I have to cut the pills in halves and quarters to get the right dose for them.  It would be really nice if they came in juvenile-size doses.  But that's a petty complaint; I'm just grateful the drug is available in the first place.  It has transformed my sons' lives.

column2: Jamie, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor for years, and, from time to time a secondary med. In the last two years, Effexor has been upped to 375mg/day, but I have had several life-altering events, and depression remained severe.  My doc started me on abilify about six weeks ago, and the difference is AMAZING. Gradually, depressed thoughts (to which I am severely genetically predisposed)have disappeared! Now, no matter where I look in the corners of my mind, there isn't one scrap of depression visible.  It is truly lifesaving.  I have been doing very poorly for very, very long time. Now I laugh and laugh - which I've missed more than almost anything - but it is very natural ... nothing manic about it.  I am also diabetic (type 2-on insulin) and so far the Abilify has caused no problem.  The ONLY drawback may be that I get too BIG to fit through the doors in my house!  It may be a "small" price to pay, but still ...I hope this helps -- I would LOVE knowing others have been as helped by this med as I have.  God Bless all.  Jamie in No. Cal.

I was so angry, frustrated, and deeply depressed. My doctor said it was the Pristiq and he even said this medicine should be taken off the market! He put me on Abilify with Prozac and Lamictal, and I have already noticed a difference after one week. Pristiq will make you crazy!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Abilify for about 5 months now.  I had my third depressive episode in six years.  I couldn't believe it was happening again.  I have been on Lexapro for those six years.  The first episode I went on Lexapro, the second was because I tried going off of it.  This third time was triggered by a tough break up.  However, I was shocked that I could become that horribly depressed while on medication.  That was the first time I started seeing a psychiatrist.  I can't recommend it more!  I have realized that primary care physicians don't have the knowledge to treat people with more complex situation like me.  My depression was so horrible.  I was on Depakote for a month, which stabilized me, but I gained way too much weight.  Abilify seems like just the right thing for me.  I feel so much better.  My doctor is suspecting that I could have Bipolar II now based on what I went through.  I am weaning off the Lexapro and only take 5mg.  I take only 2mg of Abilify at night.  That is amazing to me that someone soooo depressed could be okay on just a little medication.  That is why it has been so vital to for me to meet with the psychiatrist.  My PC physician just had me on such a high dosage of the Lex and I had insomnia for two years and times of horrible anxiety and panic attacks which I didn't know what cased by that dosage of Lexapro.  I wanted to write something positive about the mental health field and the drugs that we take on here.  I think sometimes these boards draw in people that just want to complain and tell horror stories.  Yes sometimes there are horror stories but don't give up.  Drugs really work.  If I just took a hand full of vitamins and exercised more I would probably be dead now.  Keep at it!  I know trying different things is frustrating, but you can't stop fighting for yourself.  I am a mental health victory.  If Abilify stops working like Lexapro, then I will start fighting to find something again.

column2: bigtimetorifan@aol.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: People people PEOPLE- Just because one person had 'x y z' side effects. The problem with this (or any) medication does in NO way mean it may not work well for another. I REFUSE to take a medication who has weight gain in the top 3 of side effects. That is not worth it to me to gain anymore than 10lbs and even that is pushing it. Sorry, I am hard wired like that. Trust me Ive tried to change my thinking on weight.. My diagnosis is bipolar 1 rapid cycling and much of my life has been very chaotic. I am 38 and hoped it would have mellowed out a lot more, it has some. My current cocktail is 300mg Lamictal, 150 Wellbutrin, 750 of depakote, 25mg seroquel and now (for 1 wk) 2mg of abilify. I feel really antsy and am annoying me self a little bit. I wondered why my sleep was sucking past few days (abil might explain it) so i added a bit more seroquel and clonipin when necc. Do not recommend someone chging up meds and does willy nilly. For me I have been doing it for 25yrs and go w/ the flow of what helps me. Good luck to everyone.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: just too sensative, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My son is 17 and diagnosed bipolar and has adhd. After taking 3 dosed of abilify his jaw began to clinch so tightly I could hear his teeth grinding together and he couldnt stop. Then all of a sudden his mouth opened very wide and he couldnt close it. His tongue actually twisted inside of his mouth and he had no control over it. He couldnt speak during this but said later that the pain and spasms in his jaw muscles were terrible. He was in extreme physical and emotional distress. When I took him to the E.R. they said he had a dystonic reaction to the abilify, which is in the phenothiazipine family of meds. He was told to never take anything in that family again. After a heavy dose of benadryl in an i.v. He acted like nothing ever happened..Im glad it works so well for some people, but it looks like its back to the drawing board for us. It was such a bad experience that he really doesnt want to take anything at this point. Some people are just very sensitive to certain meds. He had a very strange reation several years ago after starting resperdol where his head turned all the way to the right side and he couldnt move it..same deal, we went to the ER, Got Benadryl, and he was fine...Hopefully one day we can can find something that will work for him without the reaction.

Cost/Benefit: Cost too high, benefits 0! **My Doc prescribed it as a substitute for Lorazepam. **Abilify causes very uncomfortable anxiety, affects thoughts . . . what was I talking about? . . . I then need to take lorazepam!I can't hold on to thoughts, talking to others leaves them and me totally confusion - they know something is "wrong". They assume I on some kind of street drug and stop talking with me - and begin to gossip. Why is it so hard to find good meds for our brains?

column9: I have been on Lexapro 15mg for 2 months. I have gone through so much in my life in the last 2 years, that I needed help from a pschologist. Vision a little blurred, but I am over 50, so my eyes might be troublesome to begin with. I am on the lowest dose of abilify, and hope that my anxiety and nightmares and anxiety subsides a little bit. I do have a lot of faith in my doctor. He does care and is willing to help me. I have gone through some much trauma, 3 family deaths within a year, a divorce of 29 years, the loss of a home, the loss of a car, the half loss of my retirement. It all came crashing down, and you know I never wanted to take my life. I know there is hope so maybe abilify will help me. Nice posts. Nice comments. I know it does not work for everyone, but my doc has faith and is willing to help me.

column2: ajv11, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 28 and have bipolar disorder with mixed states, and had been medication free for several years.  This led to instability in work and living space, as well as relationships and health.  I decided to go back on meds, and take 1500 depakote ER at night for racing thoughts and hypomania.  But it made me depressed and I still felt overwhelmed and anxious.Abilify gave me the worst side effects, but I am thrilled with it.  I take 10mg in the morning.  Nothing has worked as well on my mixed-state depression without making me a total zombie.  All other anti psychotics and anti anxieties I've tried either haven't been helpful enough or have zonked me out so I can't work.  This one made me very sick, I threw up for a few days and got chills and aggitated states.  But after sticking it out, I feel calmer and better and clearer than I have in my whole life.If you have issues with mixed states, don't write this one off because it sounds scary or the side effects are bad.  I would definitely say its at least worth considering!  I am really really glad I went with my gut feeling and tried this medicine despite its bad reputation.

column2: litekeeper, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had clinically-diagnosed depression for 30+ years.  I have taken many, many, anti-depressants. Most would work a while, then stop, necessitating going to another. My latest is Lexapro.  I am also taking Lamictal to smooth out the edges (signs of bipolar II). I take Xanax for anxiety and Ambien CR to help me sleep. One day I woke up and there was dead silence in my head, whereas there's usually some kind of noise or static. It was unnerving! Talked to my shrink, he gave me Abilify, at first 2 mg per night, then after my telling him it was doing NOTHING, he increased it to 10 mg per night. Haven't really been on it long enough to judge. Was fairly happy with drug combination until this Abilify, even though it's very easy to take. Price is A FACTOR:  Both Lexapro and Abilify cost $100 each. Lamictal costs $50, but at least I do have a good insurance. My mother is paying for all the medications at the current time, which helps me out enormously, while I pay off my credit cards. When they are paid off, I will resume paying for my own meds.

column9: My son is 7 years old and now has been on Abilify for a year. The overall experience has been 10fold much better than the alternative. He used to be so angry all the time. I hated waking him in the mornings, school for him was a war zone. He has improved at school with learning and listening. The bad effects he does have is even though it causes a VERY deep sleep for him he still has night terrors. He has went from 2mg, to 3mg, to now 5mg. For a year I had been paying $89 a month (for a 30 day supply while he took a pill and half) from our local pharmacy. I called our BCBS and Walmart, Walgreens, and HyVee offers a 90 day programs that allows me to pay $100. MUCH better. The medication has worked for my child who has been diagnosed with ADD with explosive behavior.

column9: Abilify has eliminated symptoms effectively without any harsh side effects. It makes me rational and more calm if I'm aggitated. column2: astor, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son was first diagnosed with ADHD. His reactions to other medications led us to try Abilify and to question ADHD as his sole diagnosis. This medicine has been a god send for my son who is 8 years old. 2.5 mg a day of Abilify is all the medication he takes. It has made him more able to interact with other children and form and maintain friendships. He is much less reactive and irritable and is happy at school and doesn't complain about it anymore. The only down side so far is some weight gain. We have to work extra hard to get in plenty of physical activity and make healthy food choices to offset the effects of the medicine. Not the end of the world and so far managable. Things are not perfect but I would say they are 80% better for him on this medication and we are thankful everyday.

column2: SusieQ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking cymbalta,primarily for chronic pain but also for the depression that goes with it.  The doc added Abilify 3 weeks ago and I have notice a significant improvement. I realize that I have only been on it a short time though.  I also take 200 mgs of Trazadone for sleep.  I've actually noticed a decrese in my appitite (lost 10 pounds). If I get up too quickly I do get dizzy.  While I think that it is sometimes helpful to read other peoples review it's important to know we are all different and we are frequently taking other meds.  I took Serequil for 3 months and gained 30 pounds but slept like a baby. I guess that the MOST IMPORTANT THING YOU CAN DO IS MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A GOOD DOCTOR, FOLLOW THEIR DIRECTIONS, REPORT SYMPTOMS AND SIDE EFFECTS AS WELL AS ALL OTHER MEDS -OVER THE COUNTER, SUPPLEMENTS ETC, GIVE YOUR MEDS AND TIME TO SEE HOW THEY HELP OR DON'T HELP TO TREAT YOUR SYMPTOMS.  aBILIFY SEEMS TO HAVE HELPED ME SO FAR.  GOOD LUCK ALL.

I feel a lot more happy, and much less anxious about everything.  i also take 30 mg of celexa, which was recently reduced from 50 mg because of paradoxical effects.  i started feeling a lot of depersonalization that would not go away, even with klonopin.  after 7 days on abilify, i don't even think about it anymore. so far so good.  and no scary side effects.  i do think i've been eating more than usual though.  i'll have to keep an eye on that.  i was initially scared to take this med, but i'm really glad that i did.  i will update how i feel after a month of use.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: PAIN, PAIN, PAIN! I have terrible joint and muscle pain from the Abilify. It blows my mind how bad it can be at times, along with neuropathic numbness and tingling at times. I was managing my BP1 with cognitive behavioral tools and xanax for episodic agitation, because I didn't want to be on any kind of daily head meds, but after a manic epidsode that went on for days and days and crashed into full blown psychosis, I crawled back to my Doc horrified and willing to do whatever it took to never ever feel that way again. All around, Abilify has made me feel GENTLE. There is no other way to describe it. I feel easy-going, compassionate, hopeful... but also utterly undriven. My house has gone to hell, and I'm just not bothered. I have a disabling writers block (this is how I make my living, peeps), and I just feel like, oh well... it'll clear up. I have no sense of urgency.  I'm kind and loving and patient with everyone in my life, but I can't deal with the constant physical pain and the total lack of give-a-sh*t. When I have stopped taking it for a few days to "just see," the physical pain resolves, and I'm able to feel angry again, but I feel like the crazy rages are out there waiting for me. My blood sugar is through the roof, so I can't see worth a damn and I'm peeing all the time. I love feeling so fearless and gentle, but I don't think I can stay on this wonder drug. The physical side effects are too great.  I could deal with the lack of motivation, but I can't change the physical issues.  Such a shame.

I am without doubt that the Abilify has caused the tics and my fear is that they will become permanent.  My college-age daughter took a small dose to supplement Wellbutrin and was  pleased with the results generally.  However, it caused her to hyper-focus.  It does this as well to my son.

drsean, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: As a physician I feel that this med is potentially a very good medication. Based upon my specialty, I do not prescribe it, but I will say that it is important for patients to be aware that Abilify was grouped with many other atypical anti-psychotics and given a black box warning about potentially common and significant side efects (Especially severe elavations od blood glucose/potential development of type 2 Diabetes, rapid weight gain, and a host of undesirable side-effects).However, recent clinical research indicates that this drug may be far safer than the others it has been "grouped with" (i.e. Zyprexa, Geodon ; And by no means am I stating that the benefits of the above mentioned drugs do not significantly outway the risks).Abilify is different, apparently acting primarily not only within the dopaminergic system, but specifically within the "D2 ans D3" sunsystems, exhibiting both inhibitory as well as stimulatory effects.Because I have always believed that many depressive disorders can be linked to the dopaminergic system, yet we keep hammering away at the Seretonergic and Norandronergic neurotransmitter systems, this drug may not only proove helpful to some, but more significantly may lead towards far more future research into the dopaminergic system and perhaps breakthroughs in the treatment of depressive disorders.

column2: texaggi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was put on Abilify 2mg in addition to Pristiq recently.  The drug was fast-acting (meaning I felt better in less than a week) but I am unfortunately having to stop it due to 2 side effects.  It causes insomnia (which I read about here) although for those new to the drug, taking it at *night* instead of in the morning helps a *lot* to curb the insomnia.  However, my major complaint is constipation.  I have never had such a problem in my entire life--Miralax, milk of magnesia, even prescription constipation medication was not working and I have been resorting to suppositories each and every day for two weeks to manage this.  This is on top of only 3-4h of sleep each night.  It is to the point where the side effects are worse than the benefit I am receiving.  It is a shame b/c the drug has helped me mentally but for new users, please be aware that the side effects *may* severely affect your quality of life. :(

column2: Demotage, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug is the closest thing to a miracle that I've medically encountered.  I have been on both Lexipro and Wellbutrin for a couple of years to treat my depression.  Both helped considerably, but I still had residual symptoms of depression, and I was still, for lack of a better way to describe it, only operating at 50% my normal self.  I saw the commercials on TV and I asked my psychiatrist if I could try Abilify.  He put me on a trial, and within 2 weeks, I felt my old self again.  I no longer feel depressed - and I'm actually feeling cheerful - something I've not felt in a few years.  My work performance has improved remarkably, which is good, because I was slowly digging a hole for myself there.  While I have a way to go there, I'm actually catching up, rather than falling farther behind.But here is the kicker: For many years, I've suffered from Restless Leg Syndrome (RLS).  My RLS got considerably worse when I went on anti-depressants.  I've been taking Mirapex, which helps some, but it just makes it milder, it doesn't get rid of it.  Within a week of going on Abilfy, my RLS is GONE.  For the first time in 30 years, I can sleep without my legs waking me up several times a night, or preventing me from going to sleep.

I'm also on Trazadone but that's for sleep.) I'm not going to say I don't recommend this as someone else might have a different experience because it did indeed help my symptoms but the side effects just were not worth it.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: KathrynH, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking 10 mg Abilify at night for 3 weeks. I have some intolerable side effects: insomnia (5-6 hours sleep/night), constipation, and pounding and rapid heartbeat.  I also developed such a bad sinus infection that my lymph nodes all the way from the back of my neck into my head are infected- causes much pain.  My primary care physician wants me off this medicine ASAP. I find it difficult to get an emergency appt. with my prescribing ARNP.  Abilify has been effective in stopping racing thoughts; however, the side effects are dangerous and I am stopping the medicine.  I read on the "side effects" list that acute sinus infections and rapid heartbeat are severe symptoms.  I wouldn't recommend this medicine to anyone who is sensitive to medications.  I've also gained 10 pounds in 3 weeks.

column2: flowerbomb, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: zoomginb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was taking Abilify 5mg, then down to 2mg for almost a year as an adjunct to Zoloft for depression. It truly was a wonderful combination. I was happier, and nicer, than I'd been in years. Major problem: I developed Parkinson symptoms..Falling, tripping up and down stairs, unsteady on my feet, shuffling walk, mild tremor in both hands, and restless leg syndrome. These symptoms developed gradually. At first, I didn't even notice them, until it peaked almost overnight.I'm off the abilify and the zoloft for two months now; and am happy to report these symptoms are 99% gone, just a little wobbley at times. Tomorrow I will begin a medicine called Savella. It's an SNRI Rx for fibromyalgia (which I've suffered with for years)AND it is also used for depression.."two birds w/one stone" hopefully. I hope you find this review helpful; and will be on the lookout for the symptoms I've described. I miss what I called my "be nice" pill; and am so thankful my side effects were not permanent!

column2: Socretes, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I started taking Abilify while already taking Paxil and I got pulled over by the police and had a manic meltdown. My license plate bulb was burned out. A previous person following me into town was an officer from a neighboring town and when I fumbled with my cell phone, I crossed the yellow line and I'm sure it looked like someone impared but guess what? He was wrong. I was not drinking anything but a cherry coke, so he radioed ahead and when the city police officer pulled me over, I could tell he was confused. Anyway, I broke down. I had just started taking that ablify so now I'm scared of it. My whole life has been turned upside down because of what one person assumed and then of course my reaction. It was my first manic breakdown that bad. I didn't get violent or touch anyone, it was that I said something out of the way to the officer and now I'm facing 18 months to 3 years in prison. I'll loose my license ,my house and if that happens, probably my marriage. I need mental health, not a jail cell.  Southwestern Indiana Area

column9: I have been on 2mg of Abilify for almost 2wks now along w/ 300mg of Effexor XR, 200mg of Lamictal and 1mg of Ativan. The first thing I noticed was I cannot sit still. I'm constantly shifting myself while sitting and fidgeting alot. I also noticed the insomnia. It takes me forever to fall asleep, and when I do, I wake up every few hours. My doctor actually told me that this would help me sleep better. I've also not been able to focus or concentrate... It's hard for me to even do crosswords which I enjoy doing. The worst so far is the "zoning out". My boyfriend always thinks something is wrong because I seem out-of-it, spaced out. Driving home tonight I thought my contancts were blurred and I kept trying to make my eyes water, apparently it was blurred vision which is a side effect of the Abilify. I also read alot about people gaining weight. It took me 2yrs to lose 30lbs and I feel great. Now that weight gain is one of the major side effects, I do not want to go through that again. It seems like the cons outweigh the pros in this case. I am debating whether or not to stop taking it.

column2: Mother of young teen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My teen son took Abilify for one year for severe anxiety and OCD.  Dose started at 1mg, then 2.5 and then 5.  At 5mg, his coping skills were quite good, but throughout it all, he had a 40% increase in weight (40 pounds).  Metformin was given to suppress his appetite, but the fact is that the weight gain was not in proportion to his diet; his metabolism changed.  So, due to the sluggishness he feels with the extra weight, and teasing he's had because he's "fat", he wants to go off Abilify and we support that.  Now that he is recently off, we are reminded just how effective Abilify had been.  We are trying to find alternatives that don't cause such big weight gain.

column2: Mom2Jacob, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: 11 yo son started manicing at 3 yrs old, very angry, violent, 6 to 8 hour long destructive rages.  Up and down multiple times daily. In and out of hospital, day treatment school for over a year.  Started Abilify end of July while in hospital, felt nauseated for 3 days, then completely amazing.  I have my son back for the first time in years!  He is more revved up than "normal", is I believe in a mild manic state, always (still) obsessing about one thing or another, very busy, busy, busy, but happy, not aggressive.  Furniture isn't flying across the room, knives aren't grabbed and directed at himself or others anymore and the suicide talk has disappeared.  He started public school today!  Very satisfied with this med.  Tried Depakote, Lamictal, Buspirone, Risperadol, Seroquel, Wellbutrin, Celexa, Ritalin, Adderall, Strattera, and 4 others that I cannot remember the names to.  Is now on Abilify, Buspirone, and Luvox combo....LOVE IT.  Hope other kids can get as great of a benefit as my son.  Good luck and parents...don't let others tell you what's NOT wrong with your children.

column2: cheryl c., 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I began Abilify over a year ago as an adjunct to Effexor XR. I started feeling less depressed and was even able to do all my yard work for the first time in years. After a few months I began having a very uncomfortable sense of restlessness inside and my Dr. lowered the dose and increased my Klonopin. I began having tremors in my hands which got so bad people were constantly asking why I was shaking so badly. I knew it was caused by the Abilify and took myself off of it by lowering dosage gradually, with my Drs. approval. I've been off this med for about six months and the tremors have not improved and have been told this may be permanent. I regret ever taking this med. I found out that my niece had been taking it for 2 years and developed terrible Parkinson's effects and is now on a Parkinson med she will have to be on for the rest of her life. She is only 31 yrs. old. Her Dr. told her the same ingredients are in it that were used in high concentrations by the Nazi's to torture Jews in concentration camps. I can relate, as it can be somewhat torturous to go through what we both are now. For this reason alone  I would recommend anyone beginning to have even the least amount of tremors report to your Dr. IMMEDIATELY, as it only gets worse, not better, with time.

column2: icecream4me, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've taken many atypical antipsychotics but I took Abilify for more than 10 years in doses ranging from 10-30 mgs. I've had one permanent side-effect that has not been mentioned in this forum but has been reviewed in medical journals.I started making uncontrollable noises and singing, bobbing my head, rocking, and moving my fingers simultaneously as if playing the piano. I cannot control this, I would even wake up at night humming and doing my fingers.It gets worse when I'm under stress.A neurologist diagnosed Tardive Tourette's Syndrome. It is a result of long-term use of Abilify. This post is to warn others that this can happen, occur suddenly without warning and be permenant. I am glad that so many people are finding relief with Abilify and are able to live their lives, but be careful and maybe take a drug holiday.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on Abilify to treat Bipolar Disorder. The Doctor I was seeing at the time kept me on it for 3 years because he could not accept the fact that the muscle movement problems I was having, and still have, could be Tardive Dyskinesia caused by the Abilify. He claimed my symptoms did not match the "criteria" for TD, but according to the drug manufacturer & the FDA it DOES. He also claimed that because the possibility of Abilify causing TD was so low there was no way I could have TD!I fired the Doctor, found one who knows what he's doing & got off Abilify. Now, 3 1/2 years later I STILL have Tardive Dyskinesia & it affects me daily. I'm glad it seems to help some people, but PLEASE BE CAREFUL!When I was on Abilify I had MANY other side-effects (panic attacks, agoraphobia, problems maintaining my body temperature, skin infections, hair loss, forgetting how to do things, OCD/hoarding, and more, even an autoimmune disorder that has since gone away), thankfully most of those have gone away completely (except the weight gain, skin infections, & while the hoarding tendency is better, it's still there), or at least have become tolerable, but the continuing muscle problems are very frustrating & debilitating to say the least! On a GOOD day I might be able to walk 2 blocks without trouble, on a bad day 10 feet can be a huge struggle.Abilify also caused my personality to change & I'm still trying to learn how to overcome that (I had a friend who won't speak to me now because of it).Now that I've been off Abilify I've realized that it was magnifying my moodswings.I am now on a totally natural/vitamin-based treatment program & I'm doing MUCH BETTER than I ever did on antipsychotics!PLEASE, if you notice ANY muscle problems, or ANYTHING else UNUSUAL FOR YOU, NO MATTER HOW SMALL, talk to your Doctor immediately! And if they won't listen & take it seriously FIND ANOTHER DOCTOR!!!

column9: I was given Abilify (.5 ) to aid my Wellbutrin 300 in treating my severe long -term depression.(I am also bi-polar)With one dose I started to feel better!I have LOST weight,my energy level is thru the roof and I enjoy the things I hadn't done in a long time.No insomnia,no weight gain,just a bit tired the first few days, and a feeling of being cold. column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the most horrific drug I've ever taken.  My doctor let me try this because the Risperdal I was taking had caused a lot of weight gain, and Abilify is known to cause somewhat less weight gain.  I took it for several months.  It was a terrible experience.  I had one of its most common side effects, which was anxiety and insomnia.  I had constant anxiety just gushing inside my body, and I would be awake all night, over and over again.  I started making fewer and fewer meals and just ate handfuls of peanuts instead just to stay alive because I felt too bad to cook a balanced meal.  I did lose some weight, but the situation got worse, where at 15 mg. I was starting to hear voices again, and I was afraid to ask my doctor to increase the dose because the awful anxiety might have gotten worse.  I finally switched back to Risperdal and later Invega (a slightly improved version of Risperdal), and it was the biggest relief I have ever had in my lifetime.  My sleep immediately went back to normal, no more voices, and the awful gushing anxiety just stopped.  I wish it was easier to lose weight on Invega, but I have had some success in doing so, since it's not like it causes me hunger all the time.  The weight just sort of creeps up on me with these drugs, and it's possible to eat healthy and keep a healthy weight, it just takes some effort.

column2: DivorcedWoman, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm Bipolar 1 and I had an anxiety attack about two years ago. My psychiatrist put me on Abilify to quell the attack. I don't remember the dosage. I was also takibng Lithium and Lamictal as the time. It worked well for a while but then I felt emotional numb and had cognitive clouding. I was going through a horrific custody battle for my son and was earning more time with him and I figured this was how things were going to be. I was communicating to my psychiatrist and psychologist that I was having a hard time talking to people and remembering things but my psychiatrist didn't recommend a change for almost a year which of course I was scared to do because I was gaining more time with my son. My psychologist never told me she though my meds were off she just said she thought we could move to meeting once a month as I didn't have much to say! Luckily I told a guy I was dating that I was BP and he did research on Abilify and said it was a nasty drug and that I needed to get off of it. I talked to my psychologist again and she said I think you are having cognitive clouding and that you need to talk to your psychiatrist and have your meds changed. I got off it and I'm a new person. I have emotions and can talk to people again. I've since switched counselors and she said I was probably on too high of a dose and that it's not a bad drug, but for me it robbed a year of my life. Hopefully this will help someone else and you won't have to lose so much time in your life.

column2: bladinbabe, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with clinical depression back in 2000 and Effexor worked well, but then I felt "good enough" to continuously lower the dose (With my Dr approval) to 75 mg and then lost it one weekend, anger like I'd never felt before. Went up to 225 mg Effexor but had horrible night sweats so went down to 150 mg effexor and added abilify. Started with 2mg, felt no improvement. Upped to 5 mg and thought I was doing well, but Dr upped to 10 mg (still taking 150 mg Effexor). No one told me about the weight gain and I'm SOOO relieved to hear that so many others had that side effect. I've gained 20 lbs in three months despite a rigorous exercise program and diet. I can't stand having this huge belly, never have been out of shape before. Meeting with Dr in 2 weeks and will be asking to wean me off this drug.

column2: cassie6212, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I normally wouldnt take the time to post this but I think I have some valuable information to offer.  My sister and I are both bipolar.  Having gone through the various mood stabilizers and see her reactions to mood stabilizers, I can tell you that there isn't a single med that works the same for everyone.  So my advice would be to try as many meds as you can giving each atleast 4 weeks to get the full effect then decide which has the least bad side effects.  For me, its abilify.  Granted I went from 120 to 170 and I eat healthy and got a Y membership but cant get the weight off, but I'm sooo much more of a pleasant stable person now than I have ever been.

column2: allenm, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: OMG. I have been depressed and suicidal since 1980. My father killed himself as did my son. I have been on anti-depressants since 1993. All helped for a while keeping me out of the deepest black pit most of the time. But I never felt really good, just blah. I tried Zoloft, Lexapro, several others, all of which were less effective over time. I have been on Effexor XR 150mg for 4 years. I felt, as usual, blah and hoped I would not wake up in the morning. Suicide was not a logical possibility as I couldn't put my wife thru a second one after my son. The only way I thought I might kill myself was suddenly, in anger. One month ago I went to a new doctor who suggested I try Abilify. I has seen the ads but never thought I could get better and had no energy to try. Doc gave me two weeks of free 2mg tabs and after about 7 days Abilify switched my life back on. It is amazing and I almost am scared at how good I feel. I have not felt this good in 30 years. I have been on 2mg for 6 weeks and notice no adverse side effects. Right now, I see no need to bump the dosage.

column9: I didn't help me.  It made me feel totally numb.  I had no emotions: no tears even though I was sad; no laughter even when I knew something was funny.  I was just blah.  I had zero libido.  I also had terrible muscle stiffness.  I used to be very limber and I was just horribly stiff.  Then I got tremors.  My head would start mildly shaking and I couldn't stop it.  When I got off of it, the tremors stopped, and it took a little while, but the muscle stiffness went away.  Would not recommend this, unless there is just no other alternative.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 28 and have suffered from depression since I was 12.  I have been on and off meds.  Abilify is the first to make me feel this good.  I have amazing energy, decreased obsession with eating, and feel happy to be alive.  The negatives (which I will tolerate since the med works so well for me): jitters if I don't take my pill at the same time everyday.  I feel jumpy if I sit too long.  I get very tired in the afternoon, but a 10 minute rest and I feel great again.  I had severe headaches the first week, but they are gone now.  This drug has probably saved my life.  Yes, its side effects aren't fun, but the benefits outweigh the negatives in my case.  I hope they soon come out with a generic or reduce the price.  I take this with Lithium.

column2: abilifybad, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: took this along side Lexapro. let me just say both drugs are HORRIFIC!! i was shaking in my hands and legs, had 2 seizures, was confused all the time, couldn't feel regular emotions like crying or feeling bad, gained 40 pounds, felt awful, couldn't drive a car, lost my job, couldn't interact or identify with others, hungry all the time, became a shut in, obsessive thoughts, and so much more...oh and detoxing off both medications almost killed me-sweats, throwing up, anger, twitching, i felt like i was addicted to it. it ruined my life for 2 years and ive been trying for the last 9 months to recover. be aware. please explore all options before taking and don't be afraid to question your doctor and speak up if you have similar problems. i was naive. I feel better now that im off that poison.

column2: korny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it seemed to really help, along with the Effexor, I would love to go off all meds,since the reason I was depressed is a thing of the past,,,

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: Took Abilify 2mg with 90 mg of Cymbalta for about a year. Gained 20 lbs and started smoking about a pack a day. Decided to get off when I was plagued with extreme restlesness. My advice is to make sure you are being honest with your doctor when taking this medication, because your mood and demeanor can flip in an instance. It worked for me for about 8 mos and then it back-fired.

column2: Unfocused , 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Abilify for 2.5 months officially for depression but suspected Bipolar ( with mostly depression). I've had good energy boost. Waking in the morning is so good that I go to bed looking forward to the way I will wake in the morning. I've upped to 5mg. Tried am, pm, and am/pm split. Not sure which is best, yet. I am am also in Suboxone treatment for opiate dependence from chronic pain treatment. Almost off Suboxone, but -- and here is my major concern -- I still find it hard to concentrate well enough to write. I'm a professor and am having trouble writing scholarly material.  Find it hard to put complex argument together.  I know what I want to say, but I can't seem to get enough clarity ini my thinking to make it happen. Will go back down to 2.5 to see if this helps. I had good results at that level and thought 5 would "seal the deal." maybe the lower dose is right.  I all quite pleased but need to be able to complete my work.  I have, I should add, weird sleep things. Dozing off while trying to read, though as soon as I move around it's clear I still have the good energy level. I think I've learned, as doctor indicated, that regular sleep patterns to manage energy levels is critical.  Gaining some weight but could eat better, a lot better! I short, quite good, but not "perfect."

column2: AlyBaly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took abilify for about a year along with another depression medication. After about 6 months I ended up having involuntary muscle movements in my neck that became so bad that I had to hold my face to take a straight forward picture. I told my doctor and he did not believe me and told me to see an eye doctor and a neurologist. I spent a lot of money on the tests and they found nothing. I finally convinced my doctor to take me off of it and about 3 months later all the involuntary movements were gone.

column2: webmdreviewer, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Doctor in hospital diagnosed me with Schizophrenia, but my doctor has said he is prescribing it for Bipolar...and put me on 15mg to start...I read where this might be prescribed at higher doses for Bipolar and lower doses for Schizophrenia...at 15mg I was gaining about 1-2 pounds per month, but at the same time was actively walking outside every day...I got so that I became very dizzy and had an abrupt feeling of faint at times...I spoke to my medication prescriber's office about the dizziness and abrupt feeling of faint and to see if lowering my dose would help...went to my MD at their request to be cleared for medical reasons in order to do this and found out my blood pressure was above borderline and he wanted to put me on Lisinopril... I read online that Abilify can cause High Blood pressure or Fluctuating blood pressure...my prescriber's office still would not lower my dose...I felt this med was doing more harm than good...I then went to see a neurologist...I was told this medication can cause the dizziness and went back to my prescriber...reluctantly my dose was lowered by 5 mg...the abrupt feeling of faint has not returned by I do still get a feeling of vertigo or dizzy at times...my blood pressure went to borderline...I was told at some point if I could drop some weight this might help...I've been working out in a gym on a treadmill and lifting weights for over a year...the most weight I lost was 10 pounds...I am trying dieting now...I feel I need to ask for my dosage to be lowered again to see if my blood pressure will drop...read online in NY Times article on young adults taking Abilfy...that lowering the dose does not help with weight loss...I will continue to diet and exercise even still...and see about getting the dose to see if my blood pressure will go down...

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: tejano714, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've taken Abilify for a long time at high doses and low doses for bipolar disorder I. It's a great drug for the prescriber, it cuts down on your phone calls to him. I am so glad, I took myself off it and all other chemical straitjackets. It robs you of your soul. Your cognitive function suffers tremendously, but you don't realize it unless you have to function at a high level and deal with complex problems. It's touted as the only atypical that doesn't cause weight gain, not true! It's just another me too drug in a poorly understood class of pharmaceuticals. Yes it has a better side effect profile than Haldol. If your doctor suggests an antipsychotic for you, maybe you should ask him why he thinks you need an antipsychotic. Short term therapy maybe 2-3 days of Zyprexa are enough to take care of crisis situations. Taking this drug routinely is like taking chemo to prevent cancer. Don't think of this as a mood stabilizer. I predict it will be off the market in 8 years. Educate yourself on this class of medication, be an informed consumer. Oh yeah, I'm a pharmacist too with 34 years of experience. Is this pill really worth $600/ month. That's 3 hours of good therapy you could be getting instead. Big Pharma at it again !

column2: ???????, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been on it for 2 weeks. I felt much better after 1 or 2 doses. (2mg)I have battled depression for many years and so far this seems to be a miracle pill. I am also taking prozac and ritilan. Side effects are tolerable. The first week I wanted to eat everything in sight, but after 2 weeks it's not so bad. I eat very healthily so I have not gained any weight, I just eat more. The bigger issue is waking early; I wake up at 4:30 am like I've set an alarm clock. That's 6 1/2 hours of sleep with no naps. I am however enjoying the quiet time to read and pray. Overactivity was an issue for about a week but that seems to be susiding, although I've cleaned out the garage and basement! My spouse has noticed the difference in mood and energy level. Overall I'd give it a 9 out of 10! Thank God for the person responsible for developing this little pill!

column9: Abilify is HORRIBLE!!  I was on it for a year and it made me feel restless, anxious, and nervous. I've been on this combo for a year and feel better than I've ever felt in my life!  I also lost the Abilify-related weight gain and have a normal appetite. column2: Bensoncounseling, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 2mg-5mg of Abilify to "amplify" my Effexor 150XR BID for almost 3 years and it works very well for my "Major Depressive Disorder".The variable that has changed how much Abilify I take is whether I am taking generic Effexor XR or the Brand, in my case and in my opinion.  Thus, I need more abilify if I don't have the brand name drug.  I also notice more side affects at 5mgs.  For example, the company warns in their side effect literature that diabetic type symtoms are possible.  I have noticed these very symtoms, such as increased hunger, thirst, urination, swelling of extemities, craving sweets, etc.  Have others noticed this?  I gained 10 pounds in the last month so I am going down to 2 mg. after I check with my doctor for his approval in our overall treatment plan.  (Anytime I have tried to play doctor by myself it ends up in disaster!)I will be checking back if other people have these symptoms that lead to weight gain.  I can loose 10lbs. quickly so I am not going to stress over it, this combo of meds works the best out of sooo many I have tried.  Good luck to everyone else our there!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well I struggle with depression, anxiety, and hallucinations.  I went to my primary doctor and he first prescribed me Zyprexa, and something with both Prozac and Zyprexa in it, and then Abilify.  Abilify worked the best for me, I felt happy all the time, I didn't find myself constantly thinking about horrible things, my hallucinations became pretty mild and less consistent.  I was on it for about a month or two when I began having a bad side effect.  I find it a little funny, but I started to develop facial twitches.  My upper lip would pull the "Elvis Face" without me wanting it to and my smile would twitch on the sides as well as having other random facial twitches.  This sort of scared me out of it and I did not refill the prescription.  I'd take it again, if not for the facial twitches.  It worked really well, especially for anxiety, but it's been over a half a year since I was off of it and I'm still experiencing facial twitches.  It was helpful, though, besides the twitches.

column2: jc, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: Doctor has suggested this abilify, have reservations about using it. I put low ratings because I had to enter something in order to post. Reading the reviews to help me decide to try or not. I see some good reviews but many with bad side effects which causes me much concern and hesitant to try it.  I wish doctors would test brain chemicals before using these psych meds. My psychiatrist does not do this kind of testing before prescribing. I understand it can be done simply with saliva tests.  Have been on effexor, cymbalta, clonazapam and buspar - cymbalta was the worst to go off of - terrible withdrawal.  I understand now that many psychiatric problems can be caused by hormonal imbalance - recently was found low in adrenal, thyroid, progesterone & DHEA hormones on saliva testing.  Had to see an alternative minded doctor to get these tests. A must read for all, including doctors, is Dr. Mark Starr's book Hypothyroidism Type 2 available on amazon.com.  He explains how thyroid affects every body system including the brain and nervous system. Many people may get relief from psychiatric disorders with proper thyroid/adrenal treatment. One must find a doctor open minded enough to test for this. Hopefully, modern medicine will start to realize the interconectedness of all our body systems and give proper treatment instead of just prescribing antidepressants and other psych drugs.

column9: I was diagnosed with severe depression.  My doctor prescribed me Prozac.  It did absolutely nothing for me.  I was then prescribed Zoloft.  Alone it did nothing so my doctor added Wellbutrin, Ativan and Ambien to help all my ailments.  That cocktail did nothing help with the extreme exhaustion or motivation.  I told my doctor I was frustrated and wanted to stop taking all meds if I wasn't going to feel better.  I don't want to take pills just for the sake of taking pills.  My doctor then prescribed Celexa.  Still not much difference.  Then, he prescribed Abilify in addition to the Celexa.  I have been taking it for 2-1/2 weeks now.  It seems to be the only thing that has taken away the tiredness.  My mood has definately improved.  Every one around me notices the difference.  For the first 2 days I had a headache, but that went away and I have had no other side effects.  I would like to continue with this treatment and hopefully the effectiveness doesn't wear off after time.  I take 5mg a day.

column2: B dtr, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My mom took Abilify and Seroquel for over two years. (She had taken Risperdol before that and had a relapse.) She developed severe tardive dyskensia-mouth twitches, head and hand tremors-and her psych told her that she had Parkinson's. She had become so oversedated that she was nearly catatonic, and had lost all desire to eat or do anything except slump in her chair in front of the TV. She developed aspiration pneumonia and ended up in the hospital, where they had to put in a feeding tube because she could no longer swallow food or liquid. She was seen by a neurologist who correctly diagnosed her with tardive dyskensia--NOT Parkinson's--and put her on Clozeril. After 8 months of suffering, and intensive speech therapy, she is now home, eating regular food, and is more alert and lucid than I've seen her in years.  Please, if you are on either Abilify or Seroquel, and if you are having any symptoms like hers, tell your dr and don't take no for an answer! It's a miracle she's still alive.

column9: My daughter is 14 years old and has Bipolar Disorder.  Abilify has changed our lives.  She tried other meds (risperdal, trileptal) before Abilify because of insurance reasons and they did not help her.  She takes it along with Lamictal and the combination helps to put her in remission.  She recently was triggered by the unseasonably spring-like weather and an increase in dosage did the trick almost immediately.  She normally takes Abilify 10mg and Lamictal 150mg once daily.  To deal with her current relapse she is now at Abilify 15mg.  I hope that this review can give some other parent hope.  When we were struggling for a year to find the right medications for her, I was desperate to find good reviews among some of the bad ones.  This medication has given us our lives back.  I only hope that she will be able to continue on with it for a long period of time.  As far as side effects go, when she goes through med increases/decreases she may experience painful headaches and overwhelming nausea.  This always passes within a 2-3 days.
