column2: Ashley W., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had severe allergic reaction. Almost died. Hallucination, confusion, suicidal thoughts, excessive sweating in palms.  Hands drawn up, ankles swelled & feet to where I had to wear a man's size 7W shoe.  2 sizes larger than normal. difficulty urinating. muscle spasms. Pretty much 95% of the side effects that could occur did occur.  I went off 2 mg.Dr. had me discontinue w/o cutting back.  My arms and hands drew up.  Had to take cogentin, vistaril, and valium to counter-act the muscles drawing up.  I continue to this day to take these medications.  It was a yr ago in January that I quit taking this medicine.  I wasn't even on it for 3 weeks.  It has taken over a yr. to get mobility back.  In the first month of quitting ablify, I could not use my hands.  My mother had to feed me, bathe me, dress me.  I could not do anything for myself.  I couldn't walk down my stairs, so I was house-ridden for an entire month!  I did not sleep for several days.  I could not lay, or sit.  I had to stand up 24 hours for 3 days. My mother finally got me to sit on the sofa. I could not lay in my bed. I am not 100% back to normal yet.  I am in severe pain.  My muscles still spasm especially legs, shoulders, glutes. I was taking remeron along with abilify.  I would not recommend this drug to anyone. My cousin's girlfriend had a bad experience with this drug as well. I lost over 100 lbs in less than six months after stopping abilify.  20 pounds in one week.

column2: Be of good cheer!, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Two separate times I've been prescribed Abilify 20mg or more per day for Bipolar I Disorder as an anti-psychotic and for mood swings.   This medication caused me much extreme high anxiety both times. Already having some issues of social anxiety, inherited tremor, and some tremor possibly induced by years of medicinal treatment for differing aspects of manic-depression, I really was at a severe disadvantage by taking Abilify. For me a vicious cycle results between tremor and anxiety especially when taking Abilify. I was taking after breakfast 20mg per day this last time then stepped down to 15mg with no let up in either tremor or anxiety. Having been completely off of Abilify now for 15 days hasn't caused me any negative side effects or concerns of psychosis or mood swings. Hopefully I will now have less anxiety and tremor as the influence of the medicine leaves my body.  Manic-Depression(and in particular Bipolar I Disorder has been part of my life for over 35 years. I highly advise against Abilify if one deals with anxiety of any nature or does not realize that Abilify can be the source thereof. Hang in there!

column2: Be of good cheer!, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Abilify's use 2X in my life hasn't at all been the answer for my daily regimen of medication treatment. It like other newer anti-psychotics might bring about a clearer sense of conscious awareness; but for me the side effects are so aggravating and difficult to handle that another anti-psychotic with less side effects, was well worth making the switch. I now take Seroquel XR 200mg nightly. All anti-psychotic meds can cause weight gain and I've just about been prescribed everyone of them at different intervals. Having bipolar 1 disorder which in my case the manic stage is more prevalent does not allow for meds that would be prescribed for depression(i.e. Prozac, Zoloft, etc.). " Different strokes for different folks" is the bottom line in all medicinal treatments! June 2012 will mark 40 years of known dealing with manic-depression and even longer with anxiety issues; I'm 54 now. There's always hope; don't give up. It's the sign of a Champion to keep on keeping on. I wish I could have been of more help to whomever reads this. Have a great day!

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been taking Abilify for about 2 weeks but I don't think I'll keep taking it. So far I've had several of the side effects and a few I haven't seen listed. I'm getting really bad headaches with it (already have more than occasional migraines)and horrible stomach problems (the other side of constipation) I'm having more muscle stiffness than usual (already have fibromyalgia) and wanting to eat CONSTANTLY. I normally don't do that. From last fall to this spring I had lost between 35 and 40 lbs, now I'm gaining it back. I'm going to stop taking it while I'm ahead. Weird thing is, it didn't help with the depression that I noticed. Maybe all the side effects over-rode the "go gettem" attitude it's supposed to help with??? Anyway, didn't work for me but good luck to those it has helped. Got to say, it's not for everyone.

column2: shadowspawn, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been prescibed this medicine for anxiety. I was taking clonazapam but did not want to be adicted or develop a tolerance. Zoloft and other anti-depressants made me nervous and gave me tremors. This drug, while helping reduce anxiety, has increased my energy level to the point where I've doubled my workout (intense bicycle exercise, 30 miles every other day) and have a lot of spare energy.  Caffeine doesn't seem to affect me, but I have almost too much energy. I sleep less, work more, do more physical work. I eat more, up to 3k calories a day (I monitor myself) and still lost weight and size. I feel like I'm jumping over things, looking at things symbolically at times. Example: where things I type make sense even though mispelled. I've never been diagnosed with any of the reasons this drug is prescribed for; this is a test by my doctor and it seems to work out. But instead of nervous energy it seems as though my physical energy levels have increased ten-fold. I do not take any other drugs nor drink alcohol at all and am very active physically. My blood pressure at a rest after walking is 130/70's, heart rate is higher than normal while at rest but during workouts is average (70% of 220-my age). I am still debating the overall effectiveness but willing to go for 3 months on this drug to see if it works for my anxiety.

column2: cathy5878, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Added Abilify to Cymbalta to replace Geodon, because I continued to have urges to hibernate and overeat, missing 20-25 hours of work per month. Abilify worked very well, but as a diabetic it raised my A1c from 6.9 to 9.7 and I gained over 50 lbs in 6 months despite remaining on my diabetic regimen. Insulin needs skyrocketed and insulin resistance stayed high for over 9 months after discontinuance; A1c now finally back to 7.1 as of 4/2012. Psychiatrist replaced Abilify with 20mg of Adderall which I take at 6am with great effects, no jitters and no addictive feelings (but still sleep all day if I don't take it). For all this physical insult I paid co-payof $375 for 90 day supply of Abilify. The Adderall comes generic for $12.50. But I still have to fight to lose the Abilify weight the hard way on my own!
